scenario:
Sensors Converge, North America's largest and most influential event dedicated to sensors, electronics, and connectivity, is taking place June 24-26 at the Santa Clara Convention Center. The event has over 150 exhibitors, including 40+ first-time exhibitors, and top sponsors such as Analog Devices, STMicroelectronics, Mouser Electronics, and DigiKey. Key financial information includes the event's growth and the number of attendees expected, with thousands of attendees anticipated.

The event will feature a dynamic exhibit floor, new activations and experiences, and a robust conference program with 100+ expert-led educational sessions and multiple in-depth workshops. The program will cover three tracks: Innovation & Next-Gen Tech, Process Design & Efficiency, and Connectivity. Keynotes will be delivered by Seong-Hyok Sean Kim, Ph.D., and Sanjay Kumar, Chief Semiconductor Officer, Nokia.

New exhibitors joining the 2025 show include forward-thinking innovators such as ADW Sensor Corp, BrainChip Inc., and Renesas Electronics America, Inc. The event will also feature the Best of Sensors Awards, recognizing breakthrough innovations and outstanding achievements in the industry.

The event is expected to drive industry transformation and provide opportunities for attendees to explore real-world applications, demo game-changing technologies, and engage directly with companies pushing the boundaries of what's possible. Registration is now open at sensorsconverge.com/register.
